name: More Than Infinity Quiz | Quotes from Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Woody, I don't think we're at Andy's anymore." Buzz could have said this when he and Woody found themselves at Pizza Planet.

Of course, this quote is a spoof of one much more famous. Which of these actresses uttered a similar quote to the spoof above?
questions.explanation:
Judy Garland.

	"Toto, I've got a feeling we're not in Kansas, anymore." This famous quote came from the 1939 film "The Wizard of Oz". It was spoken by Dorothy, played by Judy Garland. After being tossed around in a whirlwind of terror, Dorothy and Toto end up in a strange new world. This is when Dorothy speaks this line. In 2005, the quote was rated as the fourth most famous of all time.

questions.text:
In "Toy Story", Slinky loves to play checkers with Woody. Perhaps he doesn't like to play with Buzz because Buzz thinks he is all that. He could have said "Never play a game of checkers against a Lightyear. Not when pride is on the line!"

This line is a spoof from which of these films?
questions.explanation:
Princess Bride.

	"Never play a game of wits against a Sicilian. Not when DEATH is on the line!" After defeating a swordsman and a giant, Westley finds Vizzini, and asks to play a game of wits to the death. Vizzini (played by Wallace Shawn), being the arrogant, stubborn man he is, decides to accept, uttering the quote mentioned earlier. "The Princess Bride" was released in 1987.

questions.text:
When Buzz clicks a button on his arm, he thinks he is calling Star Command. He could have said "Buzz phoning home base."

Of course, this made-up quote is a spoof of one far more known. E.T. is well-loved by many, and says a quote similar many times. Whose voice gave E.T. that signature rasp?
questions.explanation:
Pat Welsh.

	"E.T. phone home." In 1982's "E.T.", Pat Welsh spoke this line several times. The movie was about a cute little alien (though he actually frightens me) who gets stuck on earth. He is always wanting to contact his family, which is why he wants to phone home. Pat Welsh had her raspy voice because she was a chain smoker.

questions.text:
"Life is like an alien claw machine. You never know which one you're gonna get." Buzz and Woody manage to get stuck in a claw machine at Pizza Planet. Sid, the evil neighbor kid, played the claw game, expecting to win an alien. He won Buzz and Woody instead. He certainly didn't know he was gonna get that!

That was not the original quote; it was a spoof. Which famous title movie character famously uttered the real line?
questions.explanation:
Forrest Gump.

	"Life is like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get." Forrest Gump, from the 1994 film bearing his name, tells an older woman this line, one that his mama always says, while on a park bench. Actually, the entire movie is a backstory. We watch what really happened as Forrest tells this woman of his life.

questions.text:
When introducing himself to the other toys, Buzz mentioned he was a spaceman. He could have easily spoofed "Spaceballs" by claiming he was a "spaceman: half space, half man."

In "Spaceballs", what was the name of the half-man, half-dog who declared himself a mog?
questions.explanation:
Barf.

	"I'm a mog: half man, half dog. I'm my own best friend!" Yes, this unfortunate mog's name was indeed Barf. John Candy did a fine job portraying him in "Spaceballs" (1987). The line is spoken in a spaceship when Barf was asked who he was, and what. "Spaceballs" is a spoof of "Star Wars", and Barfolomew (yep, Barf is his shortened name) is a spoof of Chewbacca. That's right, I spoofed a spoof.

questions.text:
"They have big heads, and little arms!" When Buzz first meets the three-eyed aliens, he could have said this to describe them.

This line is a spoof of a line said by a dinosaur minion. Which animated movie contains the real quote?
questions.explanation:
Meet the Robinsons.

	"I have a big head, and little arms. I'm just not sure how well this plan was thought out." The t-rex from 2007's "Meet the Robinsons" said this line. His master had him chase the family to destroy them. When the dinosaur couldn't reach the family, he mumbled this sentence.

questions.text:
"Where has all the tea gone?" At Sid's house, Buzz was humiliated by being forced to be at a tea party, as Mrs. Nesbit. He did not actually say those words, but he could have as a spoof of Johnny Depp.

Which Johnny Depp film contains a quote about another missing beverage?
questions.explanation:
Pirates of the Caribbean.

	"Where has all the rum gone?" In the "Pirates of the Caribbean" films, Jack Sparrow loves, nay, is addicted, to rum. He asks where the rum is, or why it's gone, numerous times. The first "POTC" film was released in 2003.

questions.text:
"Woody, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship." Buzz and Woody finally started to get along. They became friends.

But Buzz didn't really say that. It is simply a spoof of which film?
questions.explanation:
Casablanca.

	"Louis, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship." This was the final line of "Casablanca," spoken by Rick (played by Humphrey Bogart), to his new friend Louis. The bar owner and the police captain had previously been somewhat at odds, but events made it clear they were on the same side. The line was not added to the film until after shooting. "Casablanca" was released in 1942.

questions.text:
"Play it, Woody. Play 'You've Got a Friend in Me'." This song was played a lot in "Toy Story", and Buzz could have asked Woody to play it again.

Wait, that's not a real quote. It is just a spoof of a classic line from the 1940s. What song is mentioned in the original quote?
questions.explanation:
As Time Goes By.

	"Play it, Sam. Play 'As Time Goes By'." Ilsa, played by Ingrid Bergman, said this to Sam while sitting on a piano bench. The two were talking, and Sam was playing. Ilsa asked him to play the song for old times sake. "Casablanca" (1942).

questions.text:
"Reach for the sky and beyond!" Instead of saying his usual "to infinity and beyond", Buzz could have said this.

Hold up, have I just spoofed "Toy Story" with more "Toy Story"? Indeed I have. Who originally said "reach for the sky"?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	"Reach for the sky!" Woody has a pull string on his back, and this is just one of the many lines he uttered when the string is pulled. The string provides entertainment for Andy, but not so much for Woody when the string gets caught and wakes up a dog. "Toy Story" was released in 1995.
